terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and track modifications
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
Software or services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed over the internet rather than installed locally on individual computers
A chronological record of all activities, changes, and access events within a system that provides accountability and traceability for compliance purposes
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit and view changes to a document as they happen, without delays or conflicts
A security method that restricts system access and permissions based on a user's role or job function within an organization
A defined sequence of steps or processes that documents must follow for review, approval, and publication within an organization
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a consistent starting point for creating similar types of documentation
The process of transferring data, documents, or systems from one platform or format to another, typically during software transitions
A centralized storage location where documents, files, or code are organized, managed, and made accessible to authorized users
Isolated collections of information that are not easily accessible or shareable across different departments or systems within an organization
The process of converting traditional paper-based or manual processes into digital, technology-enabled workflows and systems
The ability to track and document the history, location, and changes of information or processes throughout their lifecycle for compliance and quality purposes
